SourcedStatement: Humboldt County officials voted Tuesday to send a letter raising the alarm about San Francisco’s plans to bus homeless people out of the city.
Name: Humboldt County officials

SourcedStatement: Los Angeles and Sacramento counties are the two other most popular California destinations, according to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency.
Name: SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency
Justification: according to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency

SourcedStatement: When asked for comment, the San Francisco mayor’s office said it had not received the letter.
Name: San Francisco mayor’s office
Justification: When asked for comment, the San Francisco mayor’s office

SourcedStatement: “The aim isn’t to achieve a goal. It’s to get you out of our town, and it’s cheaper than arresting you,” Boden said. “The No. 1 answer to homelessness is to make them disappear. Then mayors write letters back and forth: ‘Stop sending your people here.’ Then it turns out they’re sending their people here. It shows the ridiculousness of us not trying to address why people are on the streets.”
Name: Paul Boden
Title: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “Our TAP program works really well, and hopefully San Francisco can go back to more — not just dumping — but assisting and actually helping people get help,” Humboldt Supervisor Rex Bohn said at Tuesday’s board meeting.
Name: Rex Bohn
Title: Humboldt Supervisor

SourcedStatement: new data obtained by The Standard from Humboldt’s own relocation program show that the county’s homeless people were bused to San Francisco on four occasions between October and March.
Name: Humboldt’s Transportation Assistance Program
Justification: new data obtained by The Standard from Humboldt’s own relocation program

SourcedStatement: According to the program’s website, social services staffers verify that those who use TAP will be received at their destination by a relative, friend, or appropriate agency.
Name: Humboldt’s Transportation Assistance Program

SourcedStatement: “We were dismayed to learn that our small, rural county was among the top three destinations in the state where people experiencing homelessness were sent by the program,” states a draft of the letter to San Francisco Mayor London Breed that can be seen on the Humboldt County website.
Name: Humboldt County
Justification: a draft of the letter to San Francisco Mayor London Breed that can be seen on the Humboldt County website
